strapiPost.title: Fayetteville Hosts 46th Annual Joe Martin Stage Race
strapiPost.content:
Over 750 athletes and teams representing 23 countries and all 50 United States will gather in Fayetteville today for the 46th Annual Joe Martin Stage Race, lasting May 18-21.

  • High intensity: The Joe Martin Stage Race is a 4-day, 4-stage professional men's and women's cycling race along with a 2-day, 2-stage amateur stage race culminating with the Experience Fayetteville Criterium on Sunday, May 21, as cyclists complete several high-speed laps around Downtown Fayetteville.
  • Celebrate cycling: Cheer on the racers and participate in All Wheels Welcome on Sunday from 12-4p, including a pop-up skate park, pickleball, RC car racing, and adult tricycle races! While you're downtown, stop by the Fayetteville Public Library for the National Bicycle Touring Portrait Collection, featuring photos by Adventure Cycling Association founding member Greg Siple on display through May 31.

Learn more about the event HERE.
